008 *******************************************************************************/
009
010package imagingbook.common.sift.scalespace;
011
012import java.io.PrintStream;
013
014import ij.ImagePlus;
015import ij.ImageStack;
016import imagingbook.common.util.PrintsToStream;
017
018/**
019 * <p>
020 * This abstract class defines a generic hierarchical scale space, consisting of
021 * multiple "octaves". See Sec. 25.1.4. of [1] for details.
022 * </p>
023 * <p>
024 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
025 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
026 * </p>
027 * 
028 * @author WB
029 * @version 2022/11/20
030 * @see ScaleLevel
031 * @see ScaleOctave
032 * @see GaussianScaleSpace
033 * @see DogScaleSpace
034 */
035public abstract class HierarchicalScaleSpace implements PrintsToStream {
036        
037        final int P;                                    // number of octaves
038        final int Q;                                    // number of levels per octave
039        final double sigma_s;                   // absolute scale of original image
040        final double sigma_0;                   // absolute base scale of first octave (level 0,0)
041        final int botLevel, topLevel;   // bottom and top level index in each octave
042        private final ScaleOctave[] octaves;    
043        
044        /**
045         * Constructor (non-public).
046         * 
047         * @param P the number of scale space octaves
048         * @param Q the number of scale steps (levels) per octave
049         * @param sigma_s the assumed sampling scale (typ. 0.5)
050         * @param sigma_0 the base scale of level 0 
051         * @param botLevel the index of the bottom level in each octave
052         * @param topLevel the index of the to level in each octave
053         */
054        HierarchicalScaleSpace(int P, int Q, double sigma_s, double sigma_0, int botLevel, int topLevel) {
055                this.Q = Q;
056                this.P = P;
057                this.sigma_s = sigma_s;
058                this.sigma_0 = sigma_0;
059                this.botLevel = botLevel;
060                this.topLevel = topLevel;
061                this.octaves = new ScaleOctave[P];
062        }
063        
064        /**
065         * Returns the number of octaves in this scale space.
066         * @return the number of octaves
067         */
068        public int getP() {
069                return P;
070        }
071        
072        /**
073         * Returns the number of scale levels in each octave of this scale space.
074         * @return the number of scale levels
075         */
076        public int getQ() {
077                return Q;
078        }
079        
080        /**
081         * Returns the assumed sampling scale.
082         * @return the assumed sampling scale
083         */
084        public double getSigma_s() {
085                return sigma_s;
086        }
087        
088        /**
089         * Returns the base scale assigned to level 0 of octave 0.
090         * @return the base scale
091         */
092        public double getSigma_0() {
093                return sigma_0;
094        }
095        
096        /**
097         * Returns the bottom level index in each scale space octave
098         * (e.g., this is -1 for the Gaussian scale space used in SIFT).
099         * @return the bottom level index
100         */
101        public int getBottomLevelIndex() {
102                return this.botLevel;
103        }
104        
105        /**
106         * Returns the top level index in each scale space octave
107         * (e.g., this is Q+1 for the Gaussian scale space used in SIFT).
108         * @return the top level index
109         */
110        public int getTopLevelIndex() {
111                return this.topLevel;
112        }
113        
114        /**
115         * Returns a reference to the p-th octave in this scale space.
116         * Valid octave indexes are p = 0,..,P-1 (see {@link #getP()}).
117         * 
118         * @param p the octave index
119         * @return the associated {@link ScaleOctave} instance
120         * @see #getP()
121         */
122        public ScaleOctave getOctave(int p) {
123                return octaves[p];
124        }
125        
126        // used internally only
127        void setOctave(int p, ScaleOctave oct) {
128                octaves[p] = oct;
129        }
130        
131        /**
132         * Returns the q-th scale space level of octave p in this scale space.
133         * Valid octave indexes are p = 0,..,P-1 (see {@link #getP()}).
134         * 
135         * @param p the octave index 
136         * @param q the (within-octave) level index
137         * @return the associated {@link ScaleLevel} instance
138         */
139        public ScaleLevel getScaleLevel(int p, int q) {
140                return getOctave(p).getLevel(q);
141        }
142        
143        /**
144         * Returns the absolute scale (&sigma;) at scale level p, q.
145         * 
146         * @param p the octave index 
147         * @param q the (within-octave) level index
148         * @return the absolute level scale
149         */
150        public double getAbsoluteScale(int p, float q) {
151                double m = Q * p + q;
152                return sigma_0 * Math.pow(2, m/Q);
153        }
154        
155        /**
156         * Calculates and returns the real (unscaled) x-position for a
157         * local coordinate at the specified octave.
158         * 
159         * @param p the octave index
160         * @param xp the (scale-level) local coordinate
161         * @return the original x-position
162         */
163        public double getRealX(int p, double xp) {
164                return Math.pow(2, p) * xp;     // TODO: optimize (precalculate Math.pow(p, 2))
165        }
166        
167        /**
168         * Calculates and returns the real (unscaled) y-position for a
169         * local coordinate at the specified octave.
170         * 
171         * @param p the octave index
172         * @param yp the scale-level) local coordinate
173         * @return the original y-position
174         */
175        public double getRealY(int p, double yp) {
176                return Math.pow(2, p) * yp;
177        }
178        
179        // ----------------------------------------------------------------
180        
181        @Override
182        public void printToStream(PrintStream strm) {
183                strm.println("Hierarchical Scale Space (" + this.getClass().getSimpleName() + ")");
184                for (ScaleOctave oct : octaves) {
185                        oct.printToStream(strm);
186                        strm.println();
187                }
188        }
189        
190        // ----------------------------------------------------------------
191        
192        /**
193         * Returns the contents of this scale space as an array of ImageJ
194         * ({@link ImagePlus}) images, one for each octave. Each image contains a stack
195         * of frames, one for each scale level.
196         * 
197         * @param title a string used to compose the title of the images 
198         * @return an array of {@link ImagePlus} instances.
199         */
200        public ImagePlus[] getImages(String title) {
201                ImagePlus[] images = new ImagePlus[P];
202                for (int p = 0; p < P; p++) {
203                        ImageStack stk = octaves[p].getImageStack();
204                        images[p] = new ImagePlus(title + " Octave p=" + p, stk);
205                }
206                return images;
207        }
208        
209}
